intro: Faramea longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered faramea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its attractive, elongated flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptic in shape, and have a glossy surface. Faramea longiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
